title: How to Watch ‘Rick and Morty’ Season 8 Online
description: “Rick and Morty” returns to Adult Swim for season eight. If you’re looking for ways to watch the animated series when it airs or when it’s available to stream, we got you covered with the best ways to watch online — including ways to watch for free. When Does ‘Rick and Morty’ Air? If you’d like […]
author: Rudie Obias
excerpt: New episodes of 'Rick and Morty' drops every Sunday starting on May 25, but you can watch past seasons of 'Rick and Morty' too: How to watch it online
text: If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission. “Rick and Morty” returns to Adult Swim for season eight. If you’re looking for ways to watch the animated series when it airs or when it’s available to stream, we got you covered with the best ways to watch online — including ways to watch for free. When Does ‘Rick and Morty’ Air? If you’d like to watch new episodes of “Rick and Morty,” you can watch it on Adult Swim every Sunday night starting on May 25 at 11 p.m. ET/PT. The season finale airs on Sunday, July 27. How to Watch ‘Rick and Morty’ Online There are a few ways for fans to stream “Rick and Morty” online. Live TV streaming services, such as Sling TV, Fubo TV and Hulu + Live TV are the best ways to access Adult Swim online to stream “Rick and Morty” on a TV or mobile device, like a smartphone or tablet. Check out the best ways to stream “Rick and Morty” below: Sling TV Sling TV is by far the most affordable way to stream the new season of “Rick and Morty” online. The live TV streaming platform offers Adult Swim (Cartoon Network) on their Blue package, which starts at $25.50 for your first month of service ($45.99/month afterwards). In addition to Adult Swim, Sling Blue includes NBC, ABC, Fox, Bravo, NFL Network, National Geographic, Discovery Channel and others. Learn more about Sling TV here. Please note: Pricing and channels vary based on your location. Fubo For $64.99 for the first month ($84.99/month afterwards), Fubo offers at nearly 230 channels for live TV streaming (depending on the package you pick), such as Adult Swim (Cartoon Network), ABC, NBC, E!, ESPN, Fox Sports, MTV, Comedy Central and more. You can sign up for a 7-day free trial here. Hulu + Live TV Hulu + Live TV not only includes more than 90 channels and live sports, but wraps in ESPN+ and Disney+ for only $82.99/month. The streaming service has a 3-day free trial, so you can try out the service before you commit to an entire month. In addition to Adult Swim, the streaming platform offers access to dozens of popular channels such as NBC, ABC, CBS, NFL Network, CNN, TLC, HGTV, CNN, Fox Sports and much more. DirecTV Starting at $34.99/month, DirecTV offers Adult Swim to watch new episodes of “Rick and Morty.” The streaming services “MyEntertainment” genre pack has the network, as well as more than 40 other entertainment and lifestyle channels, such as A&E, Bravo, E!, Food Network, ION, TLC, Vice and much more. And best of all? DirecTV has a 5-day free trial available to watch season 8 for free. “Rick and Morty” is also available to stream on HBO Max.
html:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

“Rick and Morty” returns to Adult Swim for season eight. If you’re looking for ways to watch the animated series when it airs or when it’s available to stream, we got you covered with the best ways to watch online — including ways to watch for free.

When Does ‘Rick and Morty’ Air?

If you’d like to watch new episodes of “Rick and Morty,” you can watch it on Adult Swim every Sunday night starting on May 25 at 11 p.m. ET/PT. The season finale airs on Sunday, July 27.

How to Watch ‘Rick and Morty’ Online

There are a few ways for fans to stream “Rick and Morty” online. Live TV streaming services, such as Sling TV, Fubo TV and Hulu + Live TV are the best ways to access Adult Swim online to stream “Rick and Morty” on a TV or mobile device, like a smartphone or tablet.

Check out the best ways to stream “Rick and Morty” below:

Sling TV

Sling TV is by far the most affordable way to stream the new season of “Rick and Morty” online. The live TV streaming platform offers Adult Swim (Cartoon Network) on their Blue package, which starts at $25.50 for your first month of service ($45.99/month afterwards).

In addition to Adult Swim, Sling Blue includes NBC, ABC, Fox, Bravo, NFL Network, National Geographic, Discovery Channel and others. Learn more about Sling TV here. Please note: Pricing and channels vary based on your location.

Fubo

For $64.99 for the first month ($84.99/month afterwards), Fubo offers at nearly 230 channels for live TV streaming (depending on the package you pick), such as Adult Swim (Cartoon Network), ABC, NBC, E!, ESPN, Fox Sports, MTV, Comedy Central and more. You can sign up for a 7-day free trial here.

Hulu + Live TV

Hulu + Live TV not only includes more than 90 channels and live sports, but wraps in ESPN+ and Disney+ for only $82.99/month. The streaming service has a 3-day free trial, so you can try out the service before you commit to an entire month.

In addition to Adult Swim, the streaming platform offers access to dozens of popular channels such as NBC, ABC, CBS, NFL Network, CNN, TLC, HGTV, CNN, Fox Sports and much more.

DirecTV

Starting at $34.99/month, DirecTV offers Adult Swim to watch new episodes of “Rick and Morty.” The streaming services “MyEntertainment” genre pack has the network, as well as more than 40 other entertainment and lifestyle channels, such as A&E, Bravo, E!, Food Network, ION, TLC, Vice and much more. And best of all? DirecTV has a 5-day free trial available to watch season 8 for free.

“Rick and Morty” is also available to stream on HBO Max.
